newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African ministers to expand on Mandela speech.
newsitem.headline: S.African ministers to expand on Mandela speech.

text.p: Key South African cabinet ministers scheduled a news conference in Cape Town on Friday to flesh out details of initiatives announced by President Nelson Mandela in his opening address to parliament earlier.
The conference was due to be headed by Labour Minister Tito Mboweni, who also heads the policy unit of the ruling African National Congress.
Safety and Security Minister Sydney Mufamadi and Justice Minister Dullah Omar were expected to comment on plans to halt South Africa's crime wave.

Minister of Provincial Affairs Mohammed Valli Moosa and Deputy Minister of Trade and Industry Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka were expected to attend the news confernece, but not Finance Minister Trevor Manuel.
